utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Water Demon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ice Dragon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Lesser Warlord of Ka’a.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not so fast. Infinite Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Infinite Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, Infinite Sheldon defeats all other cards and does not violate the rule against homemade cards because I made it at work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you understand why people don’t want to play with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, although it’s a question I’ve been pondering since preschool.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, your copy of Science magazine was in my mailbox.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Check it out, all about planets this month.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s an atom.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Agree to disagree. That’s what I love about science, there’s no one right answer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, you and Zack again, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, me and Zack again.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Were we here earlier?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, we should, we should go.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Ah, not yet. I want to talk science with the science dudes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, and the science dudes want to talk science with you. What do you want to talk about, rocks, dinosaurs, our friend the beaver?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You know, I saw this great thing on the Discovery Channel. Turns out that if you kill a starfish, it’ll just come back to life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Was the starfish wearing boxer shorts? Because you might have been watching Nickelodeon.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No, I’m almost sure that it was the Discovery Channel. It was a great show. They also said dolphins might be smarter than people.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They might be smarter than some people.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well, maybe we can do an experiment to find out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s easy enough. We’d need a large tank of water, a hoop to jump through, and a bucket of whatever bite-sized treats you find tasty.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A dolphin might.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, I see. You guys are inferring that I’m stupid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not correct. We were implying it. You then inferred it.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, for a group of guys who claim they spent most of their lives being bullied, you can be real jerks. Shame on all of you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What the hell did I do?

utterance.speaker: Penny (Opens door again)
utterance.content: You laughed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You think Penny’s right? Were we bullying Zack?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I know bullying. He left here unswirlied and his ass crack was underpants-free.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And nobody drew a penis on his forehead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: First day of cricket camp. They drew it so the testicles were my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, I think we might owe the guy an apology.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So go apologize.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You started it, we just piled on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What would I even say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Zack, I’m sorry you’re stupid. Have a Milk Dud.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A Milk Dud?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, Milk Duds, with their self-deprecating name and remarkably mild flavour, are the most apologetic of the boxed candies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got a better idea. We’re all responsible. I say we all go. Come on, who’s with me? Free comic books to anyone who comes with me. I might get punched. You really want to miss that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Junior Mints are pretty apologetic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re embarrassing yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, we came to talk to Zack. Hey, Zack.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, uh, the stuff we were saying before, we were just kidding around.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No, you weren’t. You were making fun of me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, that’s what we do. We give each other a hard time. Hey, Sheldon, you look like a praying mantis.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s very hurtful.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t know, it still wasn’t very nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Milk Dud?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, I love Milk Duds. Okay, we’re cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (to Raj)
utterance.content: Junior Mints.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You guys want to come in and have a beer?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, we’re on our way to the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard’s buying.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Really? I haven’t been to a comic book store in literally a million years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Literally? Literally a million years?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: You want to go with ’em?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Okay, see you later.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, w-w-wait-wait-wait, you’re ditching me to go look at comic books?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Are you mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not happy.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Milk Dud?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Wow, this place is awesome. Where do they keep the Archies?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In the bedrooms of ten-year-old girls, where they belong.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, no, you’re thinking old-school Archie. It’s much more sophisticated now. Like, there’s two universes, and Archie’s married to Betty in one and Veronica in the other. Midge is even breaking up with Moose.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: About time, right?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You guys finally chip in for a bodyguard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, no. Oh, this is Zack. He’s a friend of ours. Zack, this is Stuart. He owns the store.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Wow, lucky you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, I work 70 hours a week and average a dollar sixty five an hour.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Is that sarcasm?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, no, it’s an indictment of the American education system.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The Archies are over here.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yippee.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So are you guys coming to my New Year’s Eve costume party?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. We’re coming as the Justice League of America.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Switching it up from last year when we came as the Justice League of America.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To that point, it occurs to me that we might have an opportunity to finally snare Best Group Costume if we shore up our weak link, which is clearly Leonard as Superman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I got new boots this year. Guaranteed to add three inches.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s sad. Let’s ask ourselves, is there anyone we know who would make a more manly and convincing son of Krypton?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Than than Leonard in high-heeled boots? Howard’s mother in high-heeled boots?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was thinking specifically of the gentleman over there moving his lips as he enjoys the latest exploits of Betty and Veronica.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Zack?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He is the only person we know with actual muscles.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can’t replace me with Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why not? Penny did it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, she seems happier. Why wouldn’t we be?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Score. I got an Archie, Betty and Veronica, and a Jughead. All set for my weekend number twos.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Congratulations. Zack, how would you like to be Superman?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t know, sounds like a lot of responsibility.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, if Zack’s going to be Superman, I want to be Green Lantern.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I’m Green Lantern.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can be Aquaman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t want to be Aquaman. He sucks. He sucks underwater. He sucks fish pee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, I believe Aquaman uses his telepathic powers to request the fish do their business elsewhere.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey, babe.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m still mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well, you won’t be when you hear the great news.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What great news?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: We’re going to a costume party at the comic book store on New Year’s Eve, and you get to be Wonder Woman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Complete with bulletproof bracelets and lasso of truth. Invisible plane sold separately.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, why me? Wh-Why can’t your girlfriend be Wonder Woman?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She and her lab team are under quarantine. Seems at the Christmas party they were doing Jell-O shots out of petri dishes that used to contain yellow fever.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what about your friend Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy Farrah Fowler doesn’t believe in wearing costumes. She isn’t the free spirit I am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, forget it. I’m not spending my New Year’s Eve at a comic book store wearing a Wonder Woman costume.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: He says he’ll wear it if you’ll be Aquaman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re going to be late. I’m pacing nervously.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re jogging.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is how the Flash paces.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not Sheldon. I’m the Flash. And now I’m going to the Grand Canyon to scream in frustration. I’m back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m Batman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I hardly think so. The real caped crusader calls his crime-fighting cohorts when he’s running late.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I had to walk. I couldn’t get Raj on the back of my scooter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ve said this before, and I’ll say it again. Aquaman sucks.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Look up in the sky. It’s a bird. It’s a plane. I forget the rest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Let’s get this thing over with.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. But in what universe is Wonder Woman blonde?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Relax. No one’s going to be looking at her hair. Ow! I mean, ow.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hold on. The costume came with a black wig. Where is it, babe?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I’m not wearing it. It looks stupid.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Come on. We’re trying to win a contest here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Forget it. I’m not wearing the wig.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Penny, there’s no I in Justice League.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, actually.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t. He’s making our case.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Okay, babe. Uh, kind of embarrassing me in front of my friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. You know what? I changed my mind. I’m not going.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Looks like someone else is going to have to be Wonder Woman.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Babe, open up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not talking to you.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Then who are you talking to? Babe?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m the Flash. I just knocked 30,000 times.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. What do you want, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I understand why you’re upset.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. You’re afraid that costume makes you look fat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Wait, wait, does it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t worry. Wonder Woman was an Amazon. And Amazons tend to be very beefy gals.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good-bye, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But they’re not blonde, so put on your wig. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Stupid Aquaman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If it makes you feel any better, when I was dating Penny, she used to flip out on me all the time.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Whoa. You dated Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She didn’t tell you?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: She told me she dated a guy named Leonard. Who would have thought it was you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who else would it be?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t know. Somebody bigger and, yeah, sure. Why not you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I may have failed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I guess we just go without a Wonder Woman.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I don’t want to go without Penny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, great. No Superman, no Wonder Woman? All we’ve got is a skinny Flash, an Indian Aquaman, a nearsighted Green Lantern, and a teeny, tiny Dark Knight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Obviously, we’re no longer a Justice League. We have no choice but to switch to our Muppet Baby costumes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, I call Kermit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m Kermit. You’re Scooter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, man. Scooter sucks. He’s the Aquaman of the Muppet Babies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, we can still make this work. Leonard, you talk to Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What makes you think I can convince her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You got her to have sex with you. Obviously, your superpower is brainwashing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let me see if I understand this. You want me to convince my ex-girlfriend to go to a costume party with her new boyfriend just so we can win a stupid prize?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. And make her wear the black wig. Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Go away, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Go away, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s open.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not going to that party, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, listen. You don’t have to wear the wig. At this party, we’re gonna win first prize just by showing up with a girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not the wig.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did I do something? I mean, I tried to be friends with Zack, like you said, which believe me, was difficult, given how you and me used to be, you know, you and me, and now you and him are you and him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look. We’re not really me and him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then what are you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. I only started seeing Zack again so I wouldn’t be alone on New Year’s Eve. How pathetic is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not as pathetic as dressing up like this and going to a comic book store on New Year’s Eve.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You make a cute Green Arrow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Green Lantern.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Like there’s a difference.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s a big difference. Arrow. Lantern.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whatever. Look, if Zack and I had just gone to a regular club or a party, it would have been fine, but this, with the costumes, and you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing. Let’s go to the party. How do I look?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, I guarantee you’ll be the prettiest girl there.

utterance.speaker: Howard (outside the door)
utterance.content: Okay, the good news is, we have a Wonder Woman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s the bad news?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Superman probably isn’t getting laid tonight.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Aw, damn.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And the award for best group costume goes to Justice League of America number three!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you! Thank you so much!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, ten seconds to midnight.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ten, nine, eight…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, wait! I have a speech.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Seven, six…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stop counting!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Five, four, three…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is my moment, dag nab it!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Two, one! Happy New Year!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not going to say another word until you people settle down. I’m waiting.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: That was a great party. We should dress like this all the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you high?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re being a bully.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out. Those guys are breaking into that car.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What should we do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re the Justice League of America. There’s only one thing we can do. Turn around and slowly walk away.

utterance.speaker: Zack (after a moment’s thought)
utterance.content: Nah. Hold up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I know our winter thermostat setting is 72 degrees, but I’m a little warm, so I’m going to turn it down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (as The Flash, runs to the Grand Canyon)
utterance.content: Good Lord, how you frustrate me, Leonard Hofstadter! Fine.
